intro: Oritrophium llanganatense, commonly known as the Llanganate sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant features showy yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of smaller, tubular flowers. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Oritrophium llanganatense is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
